name: 5.10 "Everyone Imitates Art" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Nick.

	Carla was mad because he backed out of taking care of kids so she could go on vacation. Nick told Carla is appendix burst. Carla said it burst every time she needed something from him.

Pain in my neck.

	Diane called Sam "love of my life". Sam still wanted nothing to do with Diane so he only saw her as a pain.

questions.text: Who got published in a magazine?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam had a poem published in a magazine. Diane was not happy about it at all.

questions.text: What was the name of the poem that was published?
questions.explanation:
"Nocturne".

	Sam couldn't resist gloating to Diane that he got published. She got a rejection letter.

questions.text: When Diane said, "This sounds familiar." What did Norm reply?
questions.explanation:
"You said it 3 times."

	The line she said three times was "Where echoes dance". Diane accused Sam of plagiarizing the poem.

questions.text: What did Diane become obsessed with in this episode?
questions.correct: Proving Sam to be a fraud
questions.explanation:
Proving Sam to be a fraud.

	At one point she was smoking and Frasier said, "Diane you don't smoke." She replied, "What's your point?"

questions.text: Where did Carla go on vacation?
questions.explanation:
Graceland.

	Carla was a huge Elvis fan and went to Graceland every year. This particular year was the 10 year anniversary of Elvis' death.

questions.text: How did Sam get Diane in his office?
questions.correct: Pushed the chair she was sitting in into the office
options: Asked her to go to his office
She never went into his office
Picked her up and carried her into the office
questions.explanation:
Pushed the chair she was sitting in into the office.

	Diane was very depressed because Sam got published and all she got was a form letter. Sam wanted to make her feel better with some news he had, but didn't want to do it in the bar itself.

questions.text: Who really wrote the poem that Sam got published?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane had written the poem as a love letter to Sam when they were dating. She found out it was her poem and thought it was brilliant. When Sam mentioned that she said it was horrible earlier, she said, "I'm a poet not a critic."

questions.text: What did Sam get caught doing?
questions.correct: Putting away a love letter from Diane
questions.explanation:
Putting away a love letter from Diane.

	Diane at first was excited because it meant she was published. Then she was upset that he stole her poem. Then she was happy again because Sam saved all her love letters.
